intro: Ribes uva-crispa f. oblongum, commonly known as the European gooseberry, is a variant of the European gooseberry species. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its thorny stems and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green berries that are typically harvested in late summer. Botanically, it belongs to the family Grossulariaceae and is native to Europe and western Asia. Its berries are edible and have been used in culinary and medicinal applications for centuries.
